p: The use of HIV genetic sequences allowed us to investigate the impact that an intervention might have had on a specific community and epidemic dynamics, during and after the years it was implemented. While there might have been other factors that have contributed to the reduction in R e and the decrease in the average infectious period in Odessa, this exercise allowed us to monitor transmission dynamics in certain communities and further promote preventive strategies associated with a positive dynamics in monitored epidemiological parameters. Importantly, molecular epidemiology methods are a useful tool when investigating the effect of certain prevention strategies and should be widely applied in public health settings.
